001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.units.Measure;
010import edu.wpi.first.units.Time;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.Set;
013import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
014import java.util.function.Supplier;
015
016/**
017 * Namespace for command factory methods.
018 *
019 * <p>For convenience, you might want to static import the members of this class.
020 */
021public final class Commands {
022  /**
023   * Constructs a command that does nothing, finishing immediately.
024   *
025   * @return the command
026   */
027  public static Command none() {
028    return new InstantCommand();
029  }
030
031  /**
032   * Constructs a command that does nothing until interrupted.
033   *
034   * @param requirements Subsystems to require
035   * @return the command
036   */
037  public static Command idle(Subsystem... requirements) {
038    return run(() -> {}, requirements);
039  }
040
041  // Action Commands
042
043  /**
044   * Constructs a command that runs an action once and finishes.
045   *
046   * @param action the action to run
047   * @param requirements subsystems the action requires
048   * @return the command
049   * @see InstantCommand
050   */
051  public static Command runOnce(Runnable action, Subsystem... requirements) {
052    return new InstantCommand(action, requirements);
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Constructs a command that runs an action every iteration until interrupted.
057   *
058   * @param action the action to run
059   * @param requirements subsystems the action requires
060   * @return the command
061   * @see RunCommand
062   */
063  public static Command run(Runnable action, Subsystem... requirements) {
064    return new RunCommand(action, requirements);
065  }
066
067  /**
068   * Constructs a command that runs an action once and another action when the command is
069   * interrupted.
070   *
071   * @param start the action to run on start
072   * @param end the action to run on interrupt
073   * @param requirements subsystems the action requires
074   * @return the command
075   * @see StartEndCommand
076   */
077  public static Command startEnd(Runnable start, Runnable end, Subsystem... requirements) {
078    return new StartEndCommand(start, end, requirements);
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Constructs a command that runs an action every iteration until interrupted, and then runs a
083   * second action.
084   *
085   * @param run the action to run every iteration
086   * @param end the action to run on interrupt
087   * @param requirements subsystems the action requires
088   * @return the command
089   */
090  public static Command runEnd(Runnable run, Runnable end, Subsystem... requirements) {
091    requireNonNullParam(end, "end", "Command.runEnd");
092    return new FunctionalCommand(
093        () -> {}, run, interrupted -> end.run(), () -> false, requirements);
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Constructs a command that runs an action once, and then runs an action every iteration until
098   * interrupted.
099   *
100   * @param start the action to run on start
101   * @param run the action to run every iteration
102   * @param requirements subsystems the action requires
103   * @return the command
104   */
105  public static Command startRun(Runnable start, Runnable run, Subsystem... requirements) {
106    return new FunctionalCommand(start, run, interrupted -> {}, () -> false, requirements);
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Constructs a command that prints a message and finishes.
111   *
112   * @param message the message to print
113   * @return the command
114   * @see PrintCommand
115   */
116  public static Command print(String message) {
117    return new PrintCommand(message);
118  }
119
120  // Idling Commands
121
122  /**
123   * Constructs a command that does nothing, finishing after a specified duration.
124   *
125   * @param seconds after how long the command finishes
126   * @return the command
127   * @see WaitCommand
128   */
129  public static Command waitSeconds(double seconds) {
130    return new WaitCommand(seconds);
131  }
132
133  /**
134   * Constructs a command that does nothing, finishing after a specified duration.
135   *
136   * @param time after how long the command finishes
137   * @return the command
138   * @see WaitCommand
139   */
140  public static Command waitTime(Measure<Time> time) {
141    return new WaitCommand(time);
142  }
143
144  /**
145   * Constructs a command that does nothing, finishing once a condition becomes true.
146   *
147   * @param condition the condition
148   * @return the command
149   * @see WaitUntilCommand
150   */
151  public static Command waitUntil(BooleanSupplier condition) {
152    return new WaitUntilCommand(condition);
153  }
154
155  // Selector Commands
156
157  /**
158   * Runs one of two commands, based on the boolean selector function.
159   *
160   * @param onTrue the command to run if the selector function returns true
161   * @param onFalse the command to run if the selector function returns false
162   * @param selector the selector function
163   * @return the command
164   * @see ConditionalCommand
165   */
166  public static Command either(Command onTrue, Command onFalse, BooleanSupplier selector) {
167    return new ConditionalCommand(onTrue, onFalse, selector);
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Runs one of several commands, based on the selector function.
172   *
173   * @param <K> The type of key used to select the command
174   * @param selector the selector function
175   * @param commands map of commands to select from
176   * @return the command
177   * @see SelectCommand
178   */
179  public static <K> Command select(Map<K, Command> commands, Supplier<? extends K> selector) {
180    return new SelectCommand<>(commands, selector);
181  }
182
183  /**
184   * Runs the command supplied by the supplier.
185   *
186   * @param supplier the command supplier
187   * @param requirements the set of requirements for this command
188   * @return the command
189   * @see DeferredCommand
190   */
191  public static Command defer(Supplier<Command> supplier, Set<Subsystem> requirements) {
192    return new DeferredCommand(supplier, requirements);
193  }
194
195  /**
196   * Constructs a command that schedules the command returned from the supplier when initialized,
197   * and ends when it is no longer scheduled. The supplier is called when the command is
198   * initialized.
199   *
200   * @param supplier the command supplier
201   * @return the command
202   * @deprecated The ProxyCommand supplier constructor has been deprecated in favor of directly
203   *     proxying a {@link DeferredCommand}, see ProxyCommand documentation for more details. As a
204   *     replacement, consider using `defer(supplier).asProxy()`.
205   * @see ProxyCommand
206   */
207  @Deprecated(since = "2025", forRemoval = true)
208  @SuppressWarnings("removal")
209  public static Command deferredProxy(Supplier<Command> supplier) {
210    return new ProxyCommand(supplier);
211  }
212
213  // Command Groups
214
215  /**
216   * Runs a group of commands in series, one after the other.
217   *
218   * @param commands the commands to include
219   * @return the command group
220   * @see SequentialCommandGroup
221   */
222  public static Command sequence(Command... commands) {
223    return new SequentialCommandGroup(commands);
224  }
225
226  /**
227   * Runs a group of commands in series, one after the other. Once the last command ends, the group
228   * is restarted.
229   *
230   * @param commands the commands to include
231   * @return the command group
232   * @see SequentialCommandGroup
233   * @see Command#repeatedly()
234   */
235  public static Command repeatingSequence(Command... commands) {
236    return sequence(commands).repeatedly();
237  }
238
239  /**
240   * Runs a group of commands at the same time. Ends once all commands in the group finish.
241   *
242   * @param commands the commands to include
243   * @return the command
244   * @see ParallelCommandGroup
245   */
246  public static Command parallel(Command... commands) {
247    return new ParallelCommandGroup(commands);
248  }
249
250  /**
251   * Runs a group of commands at the same time. Ends once any command in the group finishes, and
252   * cancels the others.
253   *
254   * @param commands the commands to include
255   * @return the command group
256   * @see ParallelRaceGroup
257   */
258  public static Command race(Command... commands) {
259    return new ParallelRaceGroup(commands);
260  }
261
262  /**
263   * Runs a group of commands at the same time. Ends once a specific command finishes, and cancels
264   * the others.
265   *
266   * @param deadline the deadline command
267   * @param otherCommands the other commands to include
268   * @return the command group
269   * @see ParallelDeadlineGroup
270   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the deadline command is also in the otherCommands argument
271   */
272  public static Command deadline(Command deadline, Command... otherCommands) {
273    return new ParallelDeadlineGroup(deadline, otherCommands);
274  }
275
276  private Commands() {
277    throw new UnsupportedOperationException("This is a utility class");
278  }
279}
